remarks: Product of exponents law for complex exponentiation.  Variation on ~ cxpmul with more general conditions on ` A ` and ` B ` when ` C ` is an integer.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 30-May-2016.)
statement:
cxp0d.1 $e |- ( ph -> A e. CC ) $.
cxpcld.2 $e |- ( ph -> B e. CC ) $.
cxpmul2d.4 $e |- ( ph -> C e. NN0 ) $.
cxpmul2d $p |- ( ph -> ( A ^c ( B x. C ) ) = ( ( A ^c B ) ^ C ) ) $.
